page.title: 12Mills-Blythe,Shustoke.
page.content: The Dugdale family still own Blythe Mill after hundreds of years.Mr Roy Clark leases it from them.The mill that is there now was built about 2 to 3 hundred years ago,but a mill stood on the site as long ago as 1100 AD.The old wheel is not in use now because it is broken so the mill itself is just used for storage.Mr Clark sells animal feeds,fertilizers,and seeds.Inside the mill there are still a few bits of machinery but these are not in use.As the mill is by the River Blythe,it gets quite a bit of flooding.The floods usually happen in the Summer because the ground is hard and dry and the water easily runs over it.The floods are caused by the River Blythe and the River Cole which all join nearby.Mr Clark has to lift up his furniture when the floods come so it doesn't get wet.
